keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fibre broadband to all by 2025. Improved road and rail routes, reduction in delays and overcrowding on trains, investment in A47 and ensuring safe and well maintained local roads.
Minimum funding of £5000/£4000 per secondary and primary pupil, quality apprenticeships, including RAF Marham. Focus on childcare enabling parents to work flexibly.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Thriving Businesses, Rural Towns and Villages
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Crack down on business rates, helping farmers and food producers, cut red tape and a robust approach to rural crime. Protect the Brecks, Thetford Forest, and Shouldham Warren. Thriving local services, post offices, GP's, and shops. Proud we have two community led pubs.
